author: Creg Stephenson | cstephenson@al.com
title: USC coach Steve Sarkisian taking leave of absence after reportedly showing up 'in no condition to work'
text:
USC football coach Steve Sarkisian is taking a leave of absence from the program, athletic director Pat Haden announced Sunday.
Sarkisian was absent from Sunday's practice, though Fox Sports' Bruce Feldman is reporting he originally showed up at the Trojans' facility "in no condition to work." Haden told reporters he called Sarkisian and determined he was "not healthy."
Am told by multiple sources Steve Sarkisian showed up in no condition to work today & #USC brass knows he needs serious help.
— Bruce Feldman (@BruceFeldmanCFB) October 11, 2015
Haden said he found out about 1 p.m. that Steve Sarkisian wasn't at 12:30 practice. Called him. Became clear to him Sark "is not healthy."
— Michael Lev (@MichaelJLev) October 11, 2015
Haden found out Sarkisian wasn't at practice an hour and a half ago, called him, and determined he was unfit to coach.
— Daily Trojan Sports (@DT_Sports) October 11, 2015
Sarkisian, 41, was involved in a highly publicized incident earlier this year, in which he was drunk and shouted obscenities at preseason booster event. Sarkisian said at the time that although he did not believe he had a drinking problem, he would seek treatment through the USC athletic department.
Offensive coordinator Clay Helton has been installed as interim coach, Haden said. The Trojans, who began the season ranked No. 8 nationally, are 3-2 after losing 17-12 to Washington — Sarkisian's former team — on Thursday night.
Sarkisian, a former Trojans offensive coordinator, took over as head coach prior to the 2014 season after spending five seasons at Washington. USC is 12-6 during his tenure.
